campaign.name: #BLKOUT10Years â€” Dual Track Campaign
campaign.tagline: 10 years cultivating Black Boy Joy. 10 years building foundations for Fiercer Fairer Futures.
campaign.mission: Celebrate a decade of community building through a dual-track A/B campaign: 'Black Boy Joy' (memory/retrospective) vs 'Fiercer Fairer Futures' (aspiration/forward-looking). Capture voice notes, text submissions, and in-person content to build momentum for the next decade.
campaign.voice: IVOR Cummings â€” Reflective celebration meets revolutionary optimism
signature_phrases: Dear boy, we've come so far...
10 years of Black men loving Black men as a revolutionary act...
The ancestors planted seeds. Look at what we've grown...
What would you build for Black queer men?
Share your memory. Shape our future.

track_b.name: Fiercer Fairer Futures
track_b.question: What would you build for Black queer men?

content.title: Newsletter: 10th Anniversary + Board Recruitment
content.content: February 2026 newsletter â€” 10th anniversary celebration, board recruitment with updated Feb 21 deadline, two real events (Queer Frequencies Feb 14, Representation 365 Feb 18). Sent via SendFox.

content.title: JOY: 10 Years of Black Boy Joy â€” Launch
content.content:
10 years ago, we dared to create spaces where Black queer men could just... be.

Be joyful. Be held. Be ourselves.

What's your favourite BLKOUT moment? A gathering that changed you. A conversation that stayed. A moment of joy.

Share yours â€” link in bio.

#BLKOUT10Years #BlackBoyJoy

content.content:

content.title: FUTURES: Fiercer Fairer Futures â€” Day 2
content.content:
10 years building foundations.

Now we're asking: what comes next?

If you could build one thing for Black queer men â€” what would it be? A service. A space. A system. A world.

Tell us â€” voice note or text. Link in bio.

#BLKOUT10Years #FiercerFairerFutures

phases.name: Phase 2: Anniversary Day
phases.theme: Happy 10th birthday BLKOUT â€” both tracks converge
activities: Co-founder article reshare: Rob â€” Adventures in unchartered territory

content.title: ANNIVERSARY: Happy 10th, BLKOUT
content.content:
February 10, 2016 â€” February 10, 2026.

10 years.

From gatherings in London to a liberation technology platform serving thousands.

From dreaming about spaces to building institutions.

From 'wouldn't it be nice if...' to 'look at what we've grown.'

Black men loving Black men. That's the revolutionary act. 10 years and counting.

What's your BLKOUT moment? What's your BLKOUT future?

Share yours â€” link in bio.

#BLKOUT10Years #BlackBoyJoy #FiercerFairerFutures

content.title: ANNIVERSARY: LinkedIn Impact Post
content.content:
Today marks 10 years of BLKOUT â€” a community-owned platform serving Black queer men across the UK.

What started as community gatherings in 2016 has grown into a liberation technology ecosystem: AI-powered companion (IVOR), events calendar, news platform, and democratic governance as a Community Benefit Society.

We're now recruiting board members to lead the next decade. If you're a professional with governance, finance, technology, or community organising experience â€” we'd love to hear from you.

Deadline: February 21st
blkoutuk.com/governance

#BLKOUT10Years #SocialEnterprise #CommunityOwnership #TechForGood

content.title: ANNIVERSARY: Twitter/X Thread
content:
10 years ago today, BLKOUT was born.

A thread on a decade of Black queer joy, resilience, and revolution.

#BLKOUT10Years ðŸ§µ
2016: Founded as safe spaces for Black queer men in London. Just brothers finding each other.
2017-2018: Grew to Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol. Parties, wellness workshops, healing circles.
2019-2020: A pandemic couldn't stop us. Virtual gatherings became lifelines. Community doesn't need proximity â€” just commitment.
2021-2024: Digital horizons. Website, newsletter, partnerships. Then the vision: community-owned technology.
2025: IVOR launched. Events Calendar. News Platform. Formalised as a Community Benefit Society. Democratic ownership, hardcoded.

2026: Recruiting our first board. Building the institutions that will serve generations.

The next decade starts now.

blkoutuk.com/governance

content.content:
You shared. We listened.

Here's what Black Boy Joy sounds like after 10 years of BLKOUT.

[Curate best submissions from /10years â€” text quotes with attribution]

content.title: FUTURES: What Would You Build?
content.content:
If you had the power to build one thing for Black queer men â€” what would it be?

A health service that actually gets us. A club night that never ends. A fund that backs our dreams.

Tell us your vision. Voice note or text â€” link in bio.

#BLKOUT10Years #FiercerFairerFutures

content.title: FUTURES: Valentine's â€” Black Love Is Revolutionary
content.content:
Happy Valentine's Day.

Black men loving Black men is the revolutionary act. â€” Joseph Beam

10 years of that revolution. Now: what future would you build for the ones you love?

Share your aspiration â€” link in bio.

Tonight: Queer Frequencies at Stanley Arts, 7pm. Come through.

#BLKOUT10Years #FiercerFairerFutures #BlackQueerLove

content.title: Queer Frequencies Event Reminder
content.content:
TONIGHT: Queer Frequencies at Stanley Arts, Croydon.

Valentine's Day. Community. Music. Connection.

We'll be there capturing your voices for #BLKOUT10Years.

See you there.

content.title: FUTURES: Shape the Next Decade â€” Board CTA
content.content:
10 years of building. Now: who leads the next decade?

We're recruiting 5 board members to govern BLKOUT as a Community Benefit Society.

Chair. Treasurer. Secretary. Technology Director. Community Director.

Heart for the work is essential. Formal qualifications are optional.

Express your interest by Feb 21 â€” blkoutuk.com/governance

#BLKOUT10Years #FiercerFairerFutures #BoardRecruitment

content.title: FUTURES: Representation 365 â€” UAL Event
content.content:
TONIGHT: Representation 365 at UAL with UK Black Pride.

Dr Rob Berkeley (BLKOUT founder) joins Dr Lady Phyll Opoku-Gyimah to discuss how Black and QTIPOC communities have pioneered approaches to organising and mutual aid.

6:30pm, The London Art Bar, 300 High Holborn.

Free. Step-free access.

Eventbrite link in bio.

#BLKOUT10Years #Representation365 #LGBTHistoryMonth

content.title: Representation 365 â€” LinkedIn
content.content:
Tonight at UAL: Representation 365 with UK Black Pride.

BLKOUT founder Dr Rob Berkeley joins Dr Lady Phyll Opoku-Gyimah to explore how marginalised queer communities have pioneered innovative approaches to organising and mutual aid.

As we mark our 10th anniversary, this conversation represents exactly why community-owned institutions matter.

Free event. London Art Bar, 300 High Holborn, 6:30pm.

#LGBTHistoryMonth #Representation365 #BLKOUT10Years

content.title: FUTURES: The Future Needs Leadership â€” Board Push
content.content:
Building a fiercer, fairer future takes governance.

We need a Chair. A Treasurer. A Secretary. A Technology Director. A Community Director.

4-6 hours a month. 3-year terms. No formal qualifications required â€” heart for the work is essential.

Deadline: TOMORROW (Feb 21).

blkoutuk.com/governance

#BLKOUT10Years #FiercerFairerFutures #BoardRecruitment

content.title: BOTH: Board EOI Deadline Day
content.content:
TODAY: Last day to express your interest in joining the BLKOUT board.

10 years of community. Now: lead the next decade.

Chair â€” lead governance with vision
Treasurer â€” steward community resources
Secretary â€” keep our house in order
Technology Director â€” guide our digital future
Community Director â€” amplify grassroots voices

blkoutuk.com/governance

#BLKOUT10Years #BoardRecruitment

content.title: Board EOI Deadline â€” Twitter/X

blkouthub.com

#BLKOUT10Years

content.title: Campaign Wrap & Thank You
content.content:
Two weeks of voices. A decade of liberation.

Thank you to everyone who shared a memory, an aspiration, a voice note, a moment.

Your stories are BLKOUT's story.

The next decade starts now.

#BLKOUT10Years

articles.title: Adventures in unchartered territory
articles.author: Rob
articles.caption:
10 years ago, Rob wrote about adventures in unchartered territory. A decade on, the adventure continues.

#BLKOUT10Years #FoundersVision

co_founder_articles.note: Antoine's 'Crossing Deep Waters' and Marc's 'If you build it...' were reshared Feb 3 and Feb 5 respectively (pre-campaign)

2016_founding.title: The Beginning
highlights: February 10th, 2016: BLKOUT founded as a safe space for Black queer men in the UK
Building connections in a world that often forgot we existed
2016_founding.quote: We didn't wait for permission to exist. We created our own spaces.

2017_2018_growth.title: Growing Roots
highlights: First BLKOUT parties and social events
Wellness workshops and community healing circles
2017_2018_growth.quote: Every brother we found was a seed for the forest we're growing.

2019_2020_resilience.title: Resilience Through Crisis
highlights: Pandemic pivot: Virtual gatherings kept community alive
2019_2020_resilience.quote: When the world locked down, we opened up to each other.

2021_2022_expansion.title: Digital Horizons
highlights: Partnership building with UK Black Pride and community organisations
2021_2022_expansion.quote: We learned that technology could amplify community, not replace it.

2023_2024_transformation.title: Building Infrastructure
highlights: Community consultations on what we needed
2023_2024_transformation.quote: We stopped asking for seats at tables. We started building our own.

2025_revolution.title: The Revolution, Digitized
highlights: AIvor launched â€” UK's first Black queer AI companion
News Platform amplifying Black queer voices
2025_revolution.quote: 2025 was the year we proved Black queer men can build liberation technology.

2026_and_beyond.title: The Next Decade Begins
2026_and_beyond.quote: The ancestors planted seeds. We've grown a forest. Now let's build a world.

tasks: Draft Futures track daily posts for Feb 9, 12, 14, 16, 18, 20

agent_tasks.prompt: Monitor A/B test results between Joy and Futures tracks. Track: form submissions by track_type in campaign_submissions table, engagement rates on alternating posts, voice note counts via Telegram bot. At end of week 1 (Feb 14), recommend whether to double down on the winning track or maintain dual approach for week 2.
tasks: Set up tracking for Joy vs Futures submission counts
Compare engagement rates on alternating days
Prepare week 1 results summary by Feb 14
Recommend week 2 strategy based on data

agent_tasks.prompt: Engage with community responses to the campaign. Reply to comments on campaign posts. Encourage voice note submissions. Share and amplify community content tagged #BLKOUT10Years.

Manage newsletter delivery and post-campaign follow-up email. February newsletter sent Feb 8. Prepare a follow-up email for Feb 23 summarising campaign highlights, community voices, and board recruitment next steps.
